sentences.sContent: Her ex-husband had always hoped for a reconciliation.
sentences.sCn: 她的前夫一直想和她重归于好。

sentences.sContent: The treaty has brought a new spirit of reconciliation on both sides.
sentences.sCn: 条约使双方产生了新的和解精神。

sentences.sContent: The leadership announced a programme of national reconciliation (= an attempt by all sides to end a war or trouble in a country ) .
sentences.sCn: 领导层宣布了一个国内各方和解方案。

phrases.pCn: 银行对帐单，余额调节表；银行往来调节
帐目核对过程；和解过程

words.tran: 不矛盾的；可和解的；可调和的
使一致；使和解；调停，调解；使顺从

trans.tranOther: a situation in which two people, countries etc become friendly with each other again after quarrelling
